Can we copy over the boost::any implementation? Your argument holds true as long as the Any type is only used here, but I'll probably have a use case in c10 too, which might need a slightly different feature set. Having a more feature-complete implementation closer to the standard might do us some good in the future. Also because its behavior is more well-known and predictable than hand-rolling our own.
